Park Cameras School of Photography


Since 2008 Park Cameras has been providing photo enthusiasts across the country with unrivalled training options across a broad and diverse range of photographic genres and disciplines. Throughout this time our aim has been to provide interactive, intuitive and aspirational courses, workshops and seminars, beneficial to the demanding requirements of all photographers, regardless of ability or interest.

As the world of digital photography continues to expand, so does our course offering, providing an unprecedented number of courses across key imaging and software brands in our state of the art Education Suite in Sussex. Consisting of classroom, seminar and studio learning facilities, we are confident that we are able to provide the ideal environment within which photo enthusiasts can embrace their passion for photography in order to take it to the next level. Courses are now run in our London store. Today, we offer something to suit all tastes, with courses built around five key learning styles:

Day-long classroom-based learning - Professionally-led studio workshops - On location workshops - 1-2-1 training - Corporate training


Our Courses

  • Technical Photography Courses
  • Beginner Photography Courses
  • Photography Techniques
  • Photography Software Techniques
  • One to One Photography Workshops
  • Photography Experience Days and Events

Technical Photography Courses

Understanding your Digital SLR Part 1

This course aims to explain how to use your Digital SLR camera by taking you through the various modes & operations of the camera. It’s suitable for novices/beginners who have just bought a DSLR.

Book Now

Understanding your Digital SLR Part 2

This second part of our popular Understanding Your DSLR course follows on from the basics with a workshop which is purely practical based and weather permitting at two locations.

Book Now

Understanding your Canon Digital SLR

This course aims to explain how to use your Canon DSLR camera by taking you through the various modes and operations of the camera. It is suitable for anyone who has recently bought a Canon Digital SLR or upgraded from a previous camera and is looking to learn more about how their camera works.

Book Now

Understanding your Canon EOS 5D Mk IV

Understanding Your Canon EOS 5D Mark IV aims to explain how to make the most of your camera, how to navigate the comprehensive menus and explore the features of the 5D Mark VI, including Focus, ISO, HDR, Video and WIFI connectivity.

Book Now

Understanding your Canon EOS 7D Mark II

The most comprehensive course of its kind in the UK, this course explains how to make the most of your Canon 7D Mark II, navigating the comprehensive menus and the camera's advanced features.

Book Now

Understanding your Nikon D500

The aim of this course is to explain how best to use your Nikon D500, to navigate the comprehensive menu display and to give the photographer more confidence in exploring the wide range of manual controls available.

Book Now

Understanding your Olympus OM-D E-M1 Mark II

Understanding your Olympus OM-D E-M1 Mark II aims to explain how to make the most of your camera, how to navigate the comprehensive menus and explore the features of the E-M1 Mark II including Focus, ISO, HDR, Video and WI-FI connectivity.

Book Now

Beginner Photography Courses

First Steps in Photography

For anyone who has an interest in photography but is needing guidance on getting to grips with the basics of composition, camera modes and coping with different light conditions.

Book Now

Beginners Guide to Studio Photography

The perfect course to get to grips with studio photography basics for anyone interested in portrait photography using studio lighting.

Book Now

Beginner's Guide to Sensor Cleaning

Cleaning your camera sensor on a regular basis will help maintain the camera's performance whilst enabling to achieve the best possible results from your camera equipment.

Book Now

Introduction to Macro Photography

The aim of the course is to demystify the subject of macro photography and to capture detailed macro images.

Book Now

Photography Techniques

'Studio Lighting - The Portrait Workshop' - by John Clements

Photographing people is the most popular of subjects. But to do it well combines many skills such as lighting, composition and good guidance.

Book Now

Photography Software Training

Introduction to Adobe Lightroom Part 1

To cover the use of Lightroom, the appropriate tools and associated workflow guaranteed to produce the best possible results from your digital images. Suitable for those who are thinking or have bought Lightroom and are looking for the most efficient workflow related to manipulating their digital images.

Book Now

Introduction to Adobe Lightroom Part 2

This course is the follow on from Part 1 and is intended to cover the remaining modules as in Map, Book, Print, Slideshow and Web. There will also be the opportunity to revisit the content from the first course, to cover any queries and discuss various methods of workflow.

Book Now

Introduction to Adobe Photoshop Elements 14

To cover the set up and use of Adobe latest version of Elements software to organise and edit Jpeg and RAW files.

Book Now

Introduction to using RAW

To introduce the use of the RAW recording format, the benefits of using RAW over the Jpeg and the software required to work with RAW.

Book Now

1-2-1 Basic Training

1-hour Course

Benefit from our dedicated training environment and the 1-2-1 tutelage of our resident Training Manager, Anthony Sinfield, who brings with him a wealth of photographic knowledge across a broad range of subjects ensuring that you will gain the most out of your 1-2-1 training session.

Book Now

1-2-1 Advanced Training

2-hour Course

Benefit from our dedicated training environment and the 1-2-1 tutelage of our resident Training Manager, Anthony Sinfield, who brings with him a wealth of photographic knowledge across a broad range of subjects ensuring that you will gain the most out of your 1-2-1 training session.

Book Now

Photography Experience Days and Events

London Photo Walks

Our London Photo Walks are ideal for those photographers looking to travel the streets of London and hone their photographic skills and capturing some great shots with advice from our experienced trainer who will lead the walk.
